channel.title: Blanck Mass on mattischrome
channel.description: Recent content in Blanck Mass on mattischrome

item.title: Album Digest, March 2017
item.description:
Blanck Mass World Eater

This album is pretty extreme. It’s not for everyone and even for the people who can handle it, it’s not for all the time. This album is a soul crushing experience at points but there are also points of light. Perhaps this makes “World Eater” more reflective of life as a whole than any other of this month’s albums. On balance it’s probably less crushing than the last Blanck Mass album “Dumb Flesh”, which I reviewed back in June 2015.

item.title: Album Digest, June 2015
item.description:
To reboot this series, Album Digest June 2015 features five fantastic albums from Hot Chip, Jamie xx, Blanck Mass, Holly Herndon, and The Orb. I could pick loads more as I’ve listened to a lot of albums since February but I decided to focus on the more electronic material. This means that I have no excuses for not continuing next month with a rockier theme.

Hot Chip “Why Make Sense?”

Hot Chip seem to be settling in to a pattern with their album releases, alternating between messy experimental affairs and then a state of the art correction. Witness how “The Warning” smartened up the all-over-the-place “Coming On Strong” and how “One Life Stand” moulded and matured the lovestruck meandering of “Made In The Dark” into a lithe ten song set. “Why Make Sense?” takes the earnest song-based approach of “In Our Heads” and casts it into a funky fun-filled fifty minutes. It’s as concise as they’ve been since “One Life Stand”.
